message.content:
{"id": "7734", "title": "System can be shut down without savefile warnings", "description": "", "OB": "When a WSWB session is open with some opened, dirty .txt files, shutting down Windows will cause the loss of the changes in the .txt files.", "EB": "When a WSWB session is open with some opened, dirty .txt files, the system should display a warning message to give users a chance to save their changes before shutting down.", "SR": "To reproduce the issue, follow these steps:

1. Launch WSWB and create a new project.
2. Create a text file in the project and add a line of text to it.
3. Notice that the text file is marked as a dirty file.
4. Left click on the Windows Start menu and select the 'Shut Down...' command to shut down/reboot the computer.

Expected Results:
A warning or question message box should be displayed to give users a chance to save their dirty files before the computer is shut down/rebooted. Other Windows programs (like Word, Outlook, etc.) display such warnings."}

origin.input_prompt:
Your role is a senior software engineer, you are very good at analyzing and writing bug reports.
It is possible that the bug report may lack sufficient details in the OB, EB, and SR sections.  In such cases, your task is to infer the appropriate details based on the context and supplement the bug report to ensure it contains clear and complete OB/EB/SR statements.  Also, improve the wording of these statements for clarity where possible.
To facilitate this process, please provide your responses in JSON format as follows:
{"id": "", "title": "", "description": "", "OB": "", "EB": "", "SR": ""}
origin.input_content:
